CatDescriptText: Mr. Richard Puryear, 7303 Hamilton Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 29, 1958, pg.2 with question: "Do people, whom you know, place more emphasis on social life than civic responsibilities?" answer reads: "The majority of my associates assume their civic responsibilities."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Richard Puryear, wearing mustache, plaid coat, light colored striped button down collared shirt, and light colored hat and band, standing in front of light colored marble wall between store window displaying women's hats and handbags and men's shoes
